description: From French engorger, from Old French engorgier. Archaic spellings from Websterâ€™s dictionary 1913 include ingorge and ingorg, both now considered misspellings.

verbs.description: engorge (third-person singular simple present engorges, present participle engorging, simple past and past participle engorged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To devour something greedily, gorge, glut.
(pathology) To fill excessively with a body liquid, especially blood.
